thread.title: These behind-the-scenes “Rogue One” images are hauntingly beautiful
thread.title_full: These behind-the-scenes “Rogue One” images are hauntingly beautiful

author: Meaghan Kirby
title: These behind-the-scenes “Rogue One” images are hauntingly beautiful
text:
These behind-the-scenes “Rogue One” images are hauntingly beautiful If you’re like us, chances are you’re still obsessed with Rogue One: A Star Wars Story . We’re still completely enamored by the standalone film, months after its release. Alex Benetel, an Australian photographerm, is now giving us a new Star Wars gift to swoon over. Benetel was lucky enough to be asked by Disney and Instagram to take photos on the set of Rogue One and the pictures are ~truly~ stunning. 
Of the experience, which took place in London in 2015, Benetel revealed that she was the only photographer outside the United States and Canada to attend. As she explained to PetaPixel, “It was an unforgettable, once in a lifetime opportunity. There were only four of us invited and I was the only photographer outside of the U.S. and Canada.” 
Check out some of the stunning shots: 
"To strike back" 'Two Tubes' on the planet Jedha, in front of a crashed X-wing. Last year, thanks to @disneystudios, @starwarsmovies and @instagram I got to visit the set of #RogueOne to take some photographs. It was probably the most surreal, amazing, incredible, out of this world thing I've ever done!! Here is one of the main shots I took on my first day. I actually got to exhibit this piece in front of Gareth Edwards (see my Insta story) last Saturday. The set was absolutely incredible. More photos to come soon!! Only 10 more days until the film is released in the US - (8 in Aus) make sure to book your tickets. I know I am 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Dec 6, 2016 at 12:16pm PST 
"Take action" Stormtroopers ready to fight on the set of #RogueOne 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Dec 22, 2016 at 6:05pm PST 
One of the more hidden areas on the set of #RogueOne. One of the coolest areas too 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Jan 12, 2017 at 4:15pm PST 
Excited to share another batch of #RogueOne photos! Here we gooo Have you all seen it yet? 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Jan 6, 2017 at 5:48pm PST 
These pictures are so stunning, and real , we almost forget that they’re from a movie set . Benetel is able to masterfully capture the life of Jedha, Eadu, Rogue One aircraft, amongst others, and we are loving them. 
Exploring planet Jedha on the set of #RogueOne Totally spotted this guy during the first half of the film and couldn't contain my excitement! 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Dec 17, 2016 at 5:44pm PST 
Hello to all of my new #StarWars fans! Thanks for following. Still a few more shots to share from the set of #RogueOne. Another detail shot from planet Jedha 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Jan 18, 2017 at 3:49pm PST 
Empty corridors on the set of #RogueOne 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Jan 23, 2017 at 5:39pm PST 
In one of her shots, Benetel noted, “It’s amazing that amongst the incredible yet chaotic process of filming a movie, I was able to capture this quiet, yet powerful moment behind the scenes.” 
The Onlooker Rogue One Still Another one of my favourites taken on the set of #RogueOne. It's amazing that amongst the incredible yet chaotic process of filming a movie, I was able to capture this quiet, yet powerful moment behind the scenes. 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Dec 10, 2016 at 3:58pm PST 
Close up #RogueOne. Can you guess who it is? 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Jan 14, 2017 at 1:33pm PST 
Posting the photos in batches on her Instagram page, Benetel also revealed that she was able to unveil some of the photos in front o f Rogue One director Gareth Edwards . Benetel shared with her over twenty thousand Instagram followers that she attended the premiere of Rogue One , telling fans, “I don’t think I’ve ever been more excited to see a film. It exceeded all of my expectations.” 
It's official!! Rogue One is out in cinemas all over Australia! I attended the premiere last night ahh (see my story). I don't think I've ever been more excited to see a film. It exceeded all of my expectations. May the force be with you, cause it's one hell of a ride!! 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Dec 14, 2016 at 6:41pm PST 
"It's Rogue. Rogue One", powerfully said by @rizahmed's character, Bodhi Rook ⚡️ Very excited to share another capture from my visit on the #RogueOne set. Only 5 more days until Rogue One is released here in Aus!! 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Dec 10, 2016 at 3:50am PST 
In a caption, Benetel noted, “It was probably the most surreal, amazing, incredible, out of this world thing I’ve ever done!!” 
Stepping into this hidden gem on the set of #RogueOne was so surreal. Pretty sure I'm not the only one who'd want to take it for a quick spin Thanks to the shoutout from @starwarsmovies yesterday, there are a few more of you today Thanks for following! Make sure to go back and look at all the other shots I've posted! 
A photo posted by Alex Benetel (@deltalex) on Jan 21, 2017 at 3:01pm PST 
We totally agree that the photos are out of this world. We’re absolutely in love with Benetel’s photos and hope she continues to post her behind the scenes shots!
